expires_on.description: When the certificate from the authority expires.

issuer.description: The certificate authority that issued the certificate.

signature.description: The type of hash used for the certificate.

uploaded_on.description: This is the time the certificate was uploaded.

enabled.description: Indicates whether zone-level authenticated origin pulls is enabled.

GET /zones/{zone_id}/origin_tls_client_a.description: Get whether zone-level authenticated origin pulls is enabled or not. It is false by default.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

enabled.description: Indicates whether zone-level authenticated origin pulls is enabled.

200.description: Get Enablement Setting for Zone response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

enabled.description: Indicates whether zone-level authenticated origin pulls is enabled.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Get Enablement Setting for Zone response failure

POST /zones/{zone_id}/origin_tls_client_.description: Upload your own certificate you want Cloudflare to use for edge-to-origin communication to override the shared certificate. Please note that it is important to keep only one certificate active. Also, make sure to enable zone-level authenticated origin pulls by making a PUT call to settings endpoint to see the uploaded certificate in use.

PUT /zones/{zone_id}/origin_tls_client_a.description: Enable or disable zone-level authenticated origin pulls. 'enabled' should be set true either before/after the certificate is uploaded to see the certificate in use.

enabled.description: Indicates whether zone-level authenticated origin pulls is enabled.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Set Enablement for Zone response failure
